{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3553917,"name":"Nate G","username":"ThatCadGuy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thatcadguy/{size}/245471_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-11T13:13:51.546Z","cooked":"

This year we’re using the Cascade Elevator Kit from WCP. It’s our first time doing an elevator of any kind and we’ve run into a weird issue. When the elevator is going up it seems to jump and skip, we’ve tried a bunch of things and we’re not really sure what’s causing it. I took some videos to show what’s up…
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Nx3Wnb_3PEv-nau7wOMZwfBViuqRje0w?usp=sharing
My only current theory is something with over tensioned chain and/or string. The string in particular become very loose near the bottom pulley and very tight near the top pulley before it skips. Has anyone ran into this problem and know how to fix it?

Try moving it through its full range by hand, feeling for any tight spots.

Based on the video it looks like the carriage is binding, almost certainly on these fastners as they go past the back brace.

Screenshot_20250311_082028_Drive1061×865 142 KB

I suspect they need to either be shorter fastners, installed with the nut on the other side of the tube, or replaced with rivets.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-03-11T13:23:04.585Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":227,"readers_count":226,"score":75.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":495143,"topic_slug":"wcp-cascade-elevator-skipping","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/wcp-cascade-elevator-skipping/495143/2","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3553924,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-11T13:28:51.469Z","cooked":"

Seconding Skye, looks like you’re catching on fasteners. Also you’re bolting through thin wall tubing, which is deforming them and keeping the joints from getting rigid which can cause issues in elevators. I’d recommend some type of anti crush blocks in the tubes.

Alright, were try looking at that. Adding blocks for the tube is definitely a good idea.

Update: We got it fixed, the 2x1 cross brace had bowed significantly due to the elevator catching on the outtake on the front. Re-cutting and attaching said cross brace with tube plugs made it much more rigid. We had also attached the strings incorrectly, only using one clamp instead of two, so we fixed that. This along with loosening up on the chain a bit, seems to have fixed the problem. THANKS!
